name: FREQUENCY - Prior to establishing on site and as situation changes.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - All relevant properties and stakeholders contacted by works notice.
RESPONSIBLE PERSON - Paving Manager / Contract Manager
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Crew Instructions available including all surfacing requirements of the site.
RESPONSIBLE PERSON - Paving Manager / Contract Manager
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Approved plan from Southland TMC (Simon Wilson)
RESPONSIBLE PERSON - Paving Manager / Contract Manager
METHODS OR REFERENCE - Road Runner or site measurement
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Road Runner or site measurements
RESPONSIBLE PERSON - Paving Manager / Contract Manager
METHODS OR REFERENCE - Weather Forecast Data
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Consistent dry weather with no significant rainfall. +10oC for duration of paving operations.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - ICC and Paving Manager visit site to mark and agree extents.
RESPONSIBLE PERSON - Paving Manager / Contract manager
FREQUENCY - All services within milling limits
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Site walk over to confirm all services are marked prior to milling operations beginning and also documented on CBP so all staff are aware.
METHODS OR REFERENCE - Measure each side of the cut the milling machine makes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Dip check during milling to ensure 45mm mill depth achieved prior to placing mix.
METHODS OR REFERENCE - Photos and measurements
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - ICC and Paving Manager visit site to mark and agree extents.
METHODS OR REFERENCE - Photos and measurements
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - ICC provided opportunity to inspect surface and agree extents of any pre-levelling if required.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Mix design compliant with traffic category (Heavy Traffic)
3.1 - Production Testing: Binder Content, Aggregate Grading, Maximum Specific Gravity, Temperature
FREQUENCY - 1 / 200t or maximum of 3 required per production lot
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - As per material mix design and JMF specification and within production tolerances of table 5.3 NZTA M/10.
○ [exception to production testing that night if <100T were produced after a night where production testing was performed]
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Single coat G4 chipseal with 1.5 l/m² residual binder.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Paving Plan to be completed for every night with dimensions
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Joints not to be below a trafficked wheel path - M10
○ Transverse joints (start and finish) to be offset by 2m in each layer
3.5 - Check asphalt surface for deficiencies and self identify
FREQUENCY - Continuous during paving operation and site walk over post paving.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Visual inspection during paving operation, any areas of segregation are to be addressed prior to compaction
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Arrival temperature within 150deg +/- 10deg to ensure compaction can be achieved as per mix design.
FREQUENCY - Once samples have been tested
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Production samples meet NZTA M/10 specification
FREQUENCY - Once samples have been tested
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Core samples meet NZTA M/10 specification
VERIFICATION ACTIVITY - Check ride quality and surface irregularities using straight edge
METHODS OR REFERENCE - NZTA M/10 T/10
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Site passes the initial NAASRA, <5mm deviation from 3m Straight edge.
RECORDS - Site Inspection Record, NAASRA report
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Re-applied as per the existing layout and complies with NZTA P/22 specifications
○ Reinstatement within 24hrs of project finishing. Temporary limit lines installed daily.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Any service lids that were lowered and not at correct level following works are raised.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Start and stop extents bandaged.
METHODS OR REFERENCE - As requested by Asset Management Team
FREQUENCY - Within 7 working days of work completed.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Pavement structural layer extents recorded and verified by Paving Manager
○ Surfacing layer extents recorded and verified by Paving Manager
○ Mix design information of all mix provided.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Accurate as-built measurements recorded for claim.
